fieldDescription: Depending on the feature, game restart may be required
[MUST BE ENABLED FOR ANY LUNALIB SETTINGS TO WORK]
Disabling will cause vanilla asteroids to appear.
Restart not required
Restart not required
overwrites settings.json
sight is how much a ship will reveal fog of war. Restart not required
Restart not required
refers to asteroids flying into the map. Restart not required
Restart not required
refers to weapon range changes by things like safety overrides. Will multiply the range the range dropoff starts
increases how long projectiles take to fade out but not weapon range
effects all missiles, beams, projectiles, submunitions. Will not include special effects
Restart not required
for sabots, MIRV, etc
modifies hull and armor
Restart not required
Restart not required
Restart not required. High value can cause sabots to separate early. To fix, edit submunitionFeature
Restart not required
peak performance time
Restart not required
Restart not required

Restart not required. Modifies certain systems to not give flux, such as burn drive, causing it to not disable ZFSB when active, meaning that you don't have to hold forward to go back to top speed after use, unfortunately, this does not work on the orion device
Restart not required
overwrites settings.json
allows modification of many values based on particular ship or weapon
Factor by which to multiply the length and width of the combat map
Factor to multiply the map size when there are no objectaves.
Factor by which to multiply the standoff between fleets on a combat map having objectives
Factor by which to multiply fleet standoff on a combat map lacking objectives
Restart not required
how far away the ships will deploy from each other
how far away the ships will deploy from each other
amount of the space that is taken up by the deployment zone
restart not required
factor speed is reduced by each second after travel drive shuts off
set to 0 to disable
makes ships take zero hull and armor damage when they are deploying. Set to 0 to disable. Time is measured after travel drive shuts off.
Restart not required
also used by flyin asteroid feature. Restart not required
uses asteroids.csv to load more asteroid sprites. Restart required
serves as the ceiling
serves as the floor
in square map units per asteroid
forces there to be asteroids when there should be none on the map
Restart not required
in asteroids/second average per border size of a 10,000 map size
based on speed. Should be less than 1
asteroids within 300 units of player fleet
multiplied with the asteroid size
be careful setting these values, it can easily lead to a runaway effect. Restart not required
size is not in ordinary units. It is turning radius of the asteroid into a size multiplier
also not in ordinary units
maximum number of fragments
Calculated from the top down
Restart not required
effects all missiles, beams, projectiles, submunitions. Will not include special effects
Restart not required
proportion of the beam that no dropoff happens
calculated before mult. Higher number is a steeper dropoff
1 means if offset is 0 then it will be at 0 damage at max range, if lower, the beam will not reach zero. If dropoff is 0.5 then it needs to be 2 to get to zero damage at max range
Depending on the feature, game restart may be required
this does effect the range, giving the missile effectively more range
only for projectiles. Missiles use the missile modification
moves the ship speed to target value. 0.5 means the final speed will be the average between the base and target speed
moves the ship speed to target value. 0.5 means the final speed will be the average between the base and target speed
default is 0.33
default is 0.5
default is 3
Restart not required
Restart not required
Restart not required
Restart not required
fraction of hull that needs to go down before CR damage
ppt takes damage before CR. Seconds of PPT per hull proportion
CR per hull proportion
Restart not required
Restart not required
this fixes deployment yeeting the ships at max zero flux speed
The minimum zero flux speed boost if the limit is set below the zero flux speed of ships
#normally at 0. This increases the minimum flux needed for ZFSB. 1 = max flux

defaultValue:
Arbitrary settings uses JSON, and the lunalib text field is inadequate for this. Even when use lunalib is enabled, this setting will still use the settings file. Edit this value at the bottom of the better combat setting file at:
[better_combat/data/config/bcomSettings.json]

Allows modification of many values based on particular ship or weapon.

This [will not] turn features on for you. i.e. if one of these settings modifies range, and range is disabled, this will not modify the range.

Ships and weapons must meet all selected criteria to be modified.

All values are floats. Settings that are integers will be truncated.

defaultValue:
Arbitrary settings uses JSON, and the lunalib text field is inadequate for this. Even when use lunalib is enabled, this setting will still use the settings file. Edit this value at the bottom of the better combat setting file at:
[better_combat/data/config/bcomSettings.json]

Allows modification of many values based on particular ship or weapon.

This [will not] turn features on for you. i.e. if one of these settings modifies range, and range is disabled, this will not modify the range.

Ships and weapons must meet all selected criteria to be modified.

All values are floats. Settings that are integers will be truncated.
